comment.author: 98299765@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Steel Industry, and we'd love to have your photo added to the group.

comment.author: 42000613@N02
comment._content:
These are very unique looking because they appear to share the same cast house! Are also very similar in stature to the existing and operating #3 blast furnace at USS Edgar Thomson works 20 minutes away from this site over in Braddock. This would mean these were photographed freshly after a rebuild which made them some of the most modern at the time of the shoot (renovated c.1936). ET #3 retains most of its original structure and was fully renovated and and computerized/automated from 1980-87. The command center for #3 occupies the site where #4's stoves stood having been gone for more than 40 years now.

Anyone have an idea of when these Etna furnaces were torn down?
